user_question: What would be the optimal training schedule for a sprinter preparing for the Olympics?
final_answer: An optimal training schedule for a sprinter preparing for the Olympics would include a mix of speed work, strength training, recovery sessions, and technical drills, tailored to the athlete's specific needs and competition timeline.

steps.content: What would be the optimal training schedule for a sprinter preparing for the Olympics?
Plan: 1) Search for expert recommendations on training schedules for Olympic sprinters. 2) Summarize the findings and provide an optimal schedule.
Searching for optimal training schedules for Olympic sprinters.

function.name: search
function.arguments: Searching for optimal training schedules for Olympic sprinters.

steps.content: Found information on training schedules that include speed work, strength training, recovery sessions, and technical drills.

Summarize the training components: 1) Speed work 3-4 times a week. 2) Strength training 2-3 times a week. 3) Recovery sessions including yoga or swimming. 4) Technical drills focusing on start and acceleration.

An optimal training schedule for a sprinter preparing for the Olympics would include a mix of speed work, strength training, recovery sessions, and technical drills, tailored to the athlete's specific needs and competition timeline.
